info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 07 at 5:32PM MDT until June 07 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM MDT FOR NORTHEASTERN KIT CARSON COUNTY... At 531 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 9 miles north of Stratton, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. At 520 PM MDT...60 to 70 mph winds and up to half dollar size hail was reported 10 miles south of Kirk. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Burlington, Stratton and Bethune. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 422 and 437. Highway 385 between mile markers 186 and 199. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
